title.value: Multiscale PHATE identifies multimodal signatures of COVID-19
title.justification: The title is clearly stated on the first page of the paper, before the abstract.
title.quote: Multiscale PHATE identifies multimodal signatures of COVID-19

extractions.description: As the biomedical community produces increasingly complex and high-dimensional datasets, there is a need for more sophisticated computational tools to extract biological insights. This paper presents Multiscale PHATE, a method that applies to a COVID-19 dataset to predict patient disease outcomes more accurately by learning and visualizing data at multiple levels of granularity.

type.justification: The paper employs the Multiscale PHATE method on empirical clinical datasets from COVID-19 patients to demonstrate its capability in predicting disease outcomes.
type.quote: We showcase our method using 251 blood samples from 168 patients infected with SARS-CoV-2 and clinical data from 2,135 patients admitted to Yale New Haven Hospital.

name.justification: The research involves developing a computational method for analyzing biomedical data, overlapping computer science and biology, which is characteristic of the bioinformatics field.
name.quote: Built on a coarse-graining process called diffusion condensation, Multiscale PHATE learns a data topology that can be analyzed at coarse resolutions for high-level summarizations of data and at fine resolutions for detailed representations of subsets.

name.justification: The paper's focus on processing and deriving insights from complex biological datasets places it within the realm of biomedical data analysis.
name.quote: The algorithm is based on a dynamic topological process called diffusion condensation, which slowly condenses data points toward local centers of gravity to form natural, data-driven groupings across granularities.

name.justification: The use of computational methods to model biological processes and predict disease outcomes relates to computational biology.
name.quote: We present Multiscale PHATE, a method that sweeps through all levels of data granularity to learn abstracted biological features directly predictive of disease outcome.

name.justification: Multiscale PHATE is repeatedly described as the primary methodological innovation and focus of the study.
name.quote: We present Multiscale PHATE, a method that sweeps through all levels of data granularity to learn abstracted biological features directly predictive of disease outcome.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces Multiscale PHATE as a novel methodology for data analysis.
is_contributed.quote: We present Multiscale PHATE, a method that sweeps through all levels of data granularity to learn abstracted biological features ...

is_executed.justification: The paper details experiments and applications of Multiscale PHATE to data, indicating its actual execution.
is_executed.quote: Built on a coarse-graining process called diffusion condensation...to form natural, data-driven groupings.

is_compared.justification: Multiscale PHATE is compared with other dimensionality reduction and visualization tools in terms of performance and accuracy.
is_compared.quote: When combined with manifold density estimation (MELD), our approach can identify cellular populations associated with patient outcome across resolutions.

referenced_paper_title.value: Visualizing structure and transitions in high-dimensional biological data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The PHATE methodology, on which Multiscale PHATE is based, was detailed in a reference paper by Moon et al., cited in the current paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Built from 18 laboratory, clinical and demographic variables, Multiscale PHATE was used to perform multiresolution analysis of patient clinical states ...

name.justification: The dataset from the Yale IMPACT study, including clinical and biomedical data from COVID-19 patients, is used extensively in this study.
name.quote: We showcase our method using 251 blood samples from 168 patients infected with SARS-CoV-2...

referenced_paper_title.value: Longitudinal analyses reveal immunological misfiring in severe COVID-19
referenced_paper_title.justification: The Yale IMPACT Study Data is likely discussed or referenced in this study because of its relevance to COVID-19 data analyses.
referenced_paper_title.quote: e.g., reference [11]: C. Lucas et al.

name.justification: The paper mentions using MAGIC (Markov Affinity-based Graph Imputation of Cells) for denoising patient-specific signals.
name.quote: Using the geometry of the patient manifold, we denoise patient-specific signals using MAGIC...

referenced_paper_title.value: Recovering gene interactions from single-cell data using data diffusion
referenced_paper_title.justification: The MAGIC library is cited in the paper in relation to its implementation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We previously found that this leads to low-error approximations of diffusion operators in general.
